page.title: 01The Rural Landscape
page.content: The survey covers the outskirts of a small seaside town relying on the Tourist trade for a livelihood and the surrounding countryside consisting of woodland,farmland and a small village. The area has a population of approximately 5500 people which increases to about three times this number during the summer months. The outskirts of Tenby covered by our survey consists of three Private Housing Estates,part of a Council Estate and various Private Houses,Hotels and guest houses. Also in this area are the Town Cemetry and old Gas Works whose Gasmeters now store North Sea Gas. The eastern part of our survey area consists of rugged coastline,limestone cliffs with small sandy beaches.
